_header: Mourning my heart doth sore oppress
_description: A lover’s complaint — seven quatrains with refrain, ‘Alas I cannot be lovyd agayne’ or ‘Alas whan shall I be louid agayne’

BLAdd18752.Editions:
Reed,  Ernest Bliss. 
             “The Sixteenth Century Lyrics in Add. MS. 18,752.” 
             Anglia
         33 (1909): 344-69: 361.

Huddersfield.First Lines:
morenyng my hart doithe sore opressþat force constreynithe me
                    to complayneand where as I shold haue Redressea las I cannot be louid
                    a gayne…
Huddersfield.Last Lines:
…then forto loue a faithefull hartA las & cannot be louid
                    a gayne
